utility.videostream package¶

Submodules¶

utility.videostream.fps module¶

fps.py module, finds out the frames per second that was captured.

class utility.videostream.fps.FPS¶

Bases: object

a class to figure out fps.

elapsed()¶

return the total number of seconds between the start and end interval

Returns

seconds

Return type

number

fps()¶

compute the (approximate) frames per second

Returns

fps

Return type

float

start()¶

start the timer

Returns

self

Return type

fps

stop()¶

stop the timer

update()¶

increment the total number of frames examined during the start and end intervals

utility.videostream.videostream module¶

videostream.py module, it’s job is to start the camera in a thread allowing it to warm up.

class utility.videostream.videostream.VideoStream¶

Bases: object

A class containing method to save picture captured by webcam, & qrdetection

facial_recognition(vs, username)¶

playback stream, for the user to scan face. Save image users face for face recognition, and then close the stream.

Parameters

  • vs – videostream object

  • username (string) – username that’s using the camera

qr_detect(vs)¶

playback stream, for the user to scan QRCode. The content of the QRCode is saved in json format, and then close the stream.

Parameters

vs – videostream object

stream(username, purpose)¶

created a threaded video stream, allow the camera sensor to warmup, and start the FPS counter. Displays the webcam when needed, captures a picture and saves it or can detect the qrcode, read the data from it and saves it.

Parameters

username (string) – username that’s using the camera

utility.videostream.webcamvideostream module¶

class utility.videostream.webcamvideostream.WebcamVideoStream(src=0)¶

Bases: object

A class that contains methods to manage the webcam.

read()¶

return the frame stored by update.

start()¶

starts the thread

stop()¶

stop the webcam

update()¶

runs a loop to update the frame stored. stops if stopped is true
